intro: Tingulonga simplicifolia, commonly known as the simple-leaved tingulonga, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. The plant is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in dry or semi-arid environments.
